And from a great film to an extremely average film.

Ghosted

I see what they were going for, a role reversed Knight & Day but for me nowhere near as good or as fun. It was ok but certainly not a romantic action comedy I would watch again. Would much prefer to rewatch Knight & Day 10x over.

It's a shame as most of the Apple TV + movies I've watched have been great fun.

#34,679

. Does Butler always choose rubbish?

Greenland is a really good disaster/survival film - one of the best I’ve seen in years.

Olympus Has Fallen is a good Die Hard-esque actioner.

Hunter Killer is no Hunt For Red October but I enjoyed it a lot. Better than I was expecting.

300 is probably his signature role as King Leonidas but I don’t think it’s your thing.

300 actually sounds up my street, as I love ancient history. I would probably give that a go if it popped up on my tv. I'm not sure if I've seen OHF as it sounds the same as a number of other films, if it's the one I'm thinking of, with the White House under siege. So far, he hasn't really impressed me, but as I say I have only seen a few of his offerings.

#34,690

Den of Thieves was pretty damn good in my opinion and definitely doesn’t deserved to get classed with the rubbish.

I like loads of his films actually: Greenland, 300, Olympus, Rocknrolla, Reign of Fire all perfectly enjoyable.

Amazon recommended another of Butler's films to me last night & told me it gets 7.7 on IMDb so I dived straight in. That was Last Seen Alive (2022), another one I'd never heard of. Oddly, when I looked into the film after watching it, the actual IMDb score was only 5.6 so Amazon has its wires crossed there but I really enjoyed watching it anyway. It tells us of Butler having yet more marital woes & he's driving his wife to her parents for the two of them to start a trial separation. Along the way he stops for gas and.... she disappears, in broad daylight.

The gaps in the backstory are gradually filled in through a series of flashbacks and even if the story at the root of the film might not be too compelling and the film might not break new ground, once the stage had been set I found the film to be taut or tense for 90% of the running time. Butler does a great job again and some chewing of fingernails might be required. The ending might be a bit limp but as a slice of B movie action, this is a very pleasant way of spending about 90 minutes. The music's good in it, adding to the tension, & there's a particularly effective scene at derelict farm. 7/10.

That was Law Abiding Citizen we were talking about. I looked for that & it was available on Prime & Apple TV (out here in Italy) but in both cases it was only available with Italian language & no English subtitles. That seems weird for an English language film but it happens more frequently than I'd like!

#34,692

Exotica (1994) Atom Egoyan

Criterion

Bruce Greenwood, Elias Koteas, Sarah Polley

Intricate psychological drama that delves into themes of loss, desire, and human connections, the film does take its time but gradually does a great job in how it reveals all the hidden links between these characters and their personal traumas, its also bang on in its exploration of voyeurism, emotional isolation, and the yearning for intimacy which creates a haunting atmosphere that lingers long after the credits roll, solid stuff from Egoyan who I do find a bit hit and miss at times.

#34,693

Meg 2: The Trench (2023)

Dir: Ben Wheatley

More silly, more stupid and more dumb but the 1st one is still miles ahead of this sequel.

Yeap, lots of "Megs" and even a giant Octopus in the mix, plus the usual baddies, a small dog and one dude that even asks "Can you rub oil on my front if not the back?"

6/10

T.I.M (2023)

Dir: Spencer Brown

You know the story (Esp if you have watched the tv show "Humans")

AI is now your servant at home, does all chores until the sinister aspects start to emerge.

Gotta admit, Eamon Farren plays the Humanoid very well.

6/10

I've just looked into it & I like the sound of it very much. That will have to be a blu ray purchase for me though. It's available to stream over here but the problem is this.... with Kandahar the other night, even though it's an English speaking film & I can watch it in English, when the Arabic is spoken, that gets Italian subtitles, not English. Or if a film starts with some on screen graphics such as "In 2008 there was a global financial crisis", that will be in Italian, even with everything set to English.

The Vanishing looks like it's Dutch, French & English so that could end up as a real viper's nest so it'll have to be disc.
